metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5120 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate use of www mismatch redirects in browser navigation in Google Chrome prior to 61.0.3163.79 for Mac, Windows, and Linux, and 61.0.3163.81 for Android, allowed a remote attacker to potentially downgrade HTTPS requests to HTTP via a crafted HTML page. In other words, Chrome could transmit cleartext even though the user had entered an https URL, because of a misdesigned workaround for cases where the domain name in a URL almost matches the domain name in an X.509 server certificate (but differs in the initial "www." substring).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378').
